acts.name: Setup
acts.description: This is the beginning of the story where the main characters, setting, and initial conflict are introduced. The goal in Act 1 is to establish the foundation of the story and engage the audience's interest. It typically includes the "inciting incident," which is the event that sets the main plot in motion and disrupts the protagonist's normal life.

sequences.name: Introducing Protagonist's Daily Life
sequences.description: Showcasing the protagonist's routine, relationships, and environment.

sequences.name: Establishing World's Rules and Tone
sequences.description: Introducing the rules of the story's world and setting the tone for the narrative.

sequences.name: Presenting the Disruptive Event
sequences.description: Introducing the event that disrupts the protagonist's normal life and sets the story in motion.

sequences.name: Initial Reaction of the Protagonist
sequences.description: Portraying the protagonist's initial response and emotions upon encountering the inciting incident.

acts.name: Confrontation
acts.description: Also known as the "rising action,"  This is where the protagonist faces challenges, obstacles, and conflicts that escalate as the story progresses. The tension and stakes increase, leading to a pivotal moment known as the "climax." The climax is the highest point of tension in the story and involves the protagonist confronting the main obstacle or antagonist.

sequences.name: Reluctance or Resistance
sequences.description: Depicting the protagonist's initial reluctance or resistance to engage with the new situation.

sequences.name: Introduction of Challenges
sequences.description: Introducing challenges that push the protagonist to confront the central conflict.

sequences.name: Raising the Stakes
sequences.description: Increasing tension by introducing additional obstacles or antagonistic forces.

sequences.name: Building Tension
sequences.description: Gradually building tension and anticipation leading up to the story's climax.

sequences.name: Direct Confrontation
sequences.description: Depicting the protagonist's head-on confrontation with the main obstacle, resulting in a turning point.

acts.name: Resolution
acts.description: This is the final act where the story's conflicts are resolved. After the climax, there's a period of falling action where loose ends are tied up and the story's outcomes are determined. This act provides closure to the audience and showcases the characters' growth and transformation based on their experiences throughout the story.

sequences.name: Aftermath of the Climax
sequences.description: Addressing the aftermath of the climax and exploring the consequences of key decisions.

sequences.name: Resolution of Subplots
sequences.description: Resolving any remaining subplots or loose ends in the story.

sequences.name: Character Growth and Transformation
sequences.description: Showcasing the protagonist's growth, transformation, or change in perspective.

sequences.name: Main Conflict Resolution
sequences.description: Resolving the main conflict and demonstrating how the characters have evolved.

sequences.name: Final Character Arcs
sequences.description: Wrapping up any final character arcs or lingering plot points.

sequences.name: Sense of Closure
sequences.description: Providing a sense of closure and leaving the audience with a lasting impression.
